meanings.definition: To drink (a liquid) a little at a time
meanings.sent2: He sipped the soup to cool it down.
meanings.sent3: The cat sipped the milk with dainty licks.
meanings.sent4: The flowers sipped the raindrops like tiny straws.
meanings.sent5: Grandma sipped her coffee, savoring each small taste.

meanings.definition: To take a small mouthful of (a drink)
meanings.sent1: The child sipped the juice through a straw.
meanings.sent2: She sipped the lemonade and made a sour face.
meanings.sent3: The bird sipped the water from the birdbath delicately.
meanings.sent4: The bee sipped nectar from the flower with precision.
meanings.sent5: The hiker sipped water from the canteen, feeling refreshed.
